intro: Struthanthus amplexicaulis, commonly known as the clasping-flower bush, is a perennial shrub native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and vibrant yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has opposite, narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowering stems are typically branched and bear clusters of small, tubular flowers. Struthanthus amplexicaulis thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
